title: Over one billion galaxies blaze bright in colossal map of the sky

last_post.content:
#astronomy #SpaceExploration #maps #mapping

'By creating comprehensive maps of even the dimmest and most-distant galaxies, astronomers are better able to study the structure of the universe and unravel the mysterious properties of dark matter and dark energy. The largest such map to date has just grown even larger, with the tenth data release from the DOE's Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument (DESI) Legacy Imaging Survey.'

https://phys.org/news/2023-02-billion-galaxies-blaze-bright-colossal.html

title: Physical attacks on power grid surge to new peak

last_post.content:
Attacks on the US power grid — a preferred method of attack among extremists, particularly accelerationists — have surged to a decade-high peak this year, with more than 100 attacks reported in the first 8 months of 2022. So that’s not even including the recent spate of attacks in NC, SC, FL, GA, WA, & OR.

These kinds of attacks are seen by extremists as a crucial step towards inciting a race war.
https://www.politico.com/news/2022/12/26/physical-attacks-electrical-grid-peak-00075216

Ivory for iOS v1.2 is now out on the App Store!

- Support for “Hide with a Warning” for Mutes and Filters
- Followed Hashtags now have a badge when they appear in your Home Timeline.
- More Accessibility improvements.
- Tap/hit area for “Read More” button in the timeline is now larger.
- Various other bug fixes.

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ivory-for-mastodon-by-tapbots/id6444602274

The ability to read alt/description text on an image is coming next. https://tapbots.com/ivory/#roadmap

last_post.content:
I made a poor job at describing it but here's the thing: there are 143-161+ DOM classes nobody can extend out of a classes based PL as JS is:

Reflect.ownKeys(globalThis).filter($ => /^(?:HTML|SVG|MathML).*?Element$/.test($));

now you can with nonchalance

Did you know there's a #fediverse alternative to Amazon-owned #Goodreads? #BookWyrm is a social network for tracking your reading, writing reviews, and discovering what to read next. You can follow and interact with users on different #BookWyrm instances and on #Mastodon. You can import from a Goodreads CSV export. You can create private shelves and curated lists. Join us at https://ramblingreaders.org or choose one of the other instances available #books #reading  #bookstodon @bookstodon

Ok, I’m gonna go ahead and say that #icecubes blows the other #ios #mastodon #apps out of the water, and I have tried ALL of the@. Blazing fast, clean and easy to navigate, in-line translation, follow recommendations? YES PLEASE. And the icing on the cake? It’s free and open source. This is the kind of user-centric design that mastodon needs in order really take off. https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ice-cubes-for-mastodon/id6444915884 Thank you, @IceCubesApp

title: Picture Research by Nina Lager Vestberg: 9780262045315 | PenguinRandomHouse.com: Books

last_post.content:
Just discovered that my book is now available to pre-order 🥳

An intimate foray into the invisible work that made it possible for pictures to circulate in print and online from the 1830s to the 2010s, *Picture Research* focuses on how pictures were saved, stored, and searched for in a time before scanners, servers, and search engines, and describes the dramatic difference it made when images became scannable, searchable, and distributable via the internet.

More here: https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/722478/picture-research-by-nina-lager-vestberg/9780262045315

title: Young West - A Sequel to Looking Backward (1894) by Solomon Schindler

last_post.content:
"Young West" (1894) by Solomon Schindler is a utopian novel about America in the year 2001, and was one of dozens of unofficial sequels to Edward Bellamy's "Looking Backward." It was printed in three different editions with colored margins that would supposedly strengthen the human eye.

I bought a yellow version because I loved the gimmick, but the novel itself is actually pretty good!

I wrote about the book and its unusual author: https://lizadaly.com/pages/utopian-novels/young-west.html

I’m ecstatic to share that a talk I proposed for #pancakescon was accepted :-) It’s a great virtual event where each talk is divided in halves: first on something cyber-related and the other half is not. @hacks4pancakes has created something wonderful for the community (also many thanks to the many volunteers!) and I’m honoured I get to play a small part.

My talk will delve into the “business” side of the security industry for the first half, and I’ll touch on personal finances on the second. Talk is aptly titled “Show me the money!” :-)

Really looking forward to this!

March 19th, virtual. See you then!

https://pancakescon.com/2023-conference-information/

title: “The New York Times” Is Repeating One of Its Most Notorious Mistakes

last_post.content:
"We’ll never know how things would have been different if the Times had chosen to use its hugely influential platform to sound the alarm about AIDS in a concerted way. We only know what happened when it didn’t.

"Similarly, it’s impossible to quantify how the current wave of anti-trans hysteria would be altered if the Times decided to stop treating the existence of trans people as a knotty problem for society to solve."

https://www.thenation.com/article/society/new-york-times-trans-coverage-gay-rights-history/tnamp/

#LGBTQ #trans #NYT

We should all be using the acronym "WHMP" for total White Heterosexual Men of privilege. Pronounced "wimp", of course.

Coined by Dr. Janet E. Helms: https://theracquet.org/4433/news/award-winning-professor-discusses-race-and-privilege/

All of the institutions are designed to protect white, straight males,” explained Helms. Not all WHMP’s are Alpha WHMP’s.

The Alpha WHMP’s are the ones who have much of the power in the United States. “The politicians who will not act in gun control are the ones being funded by Alpha WHMP’s”.

Lithium Americas is a Canadian company with mining projects in the Lithium Triangle of S. America. A judge just lifted an injunction against them at Thacker Pass, NV that will run over Native Americans there, and compete with drinking and agricultural water. One metric ton of lithium requires up to 500,000 gallons of water. There is nothing green about lithium. title: Hidden Tapas Restaurant From Monarch Team Opens Behind Fake Pawn Shop in SoMa

last_post.content: had dinner last night at the Pawn Shop, ahead of seeing a show at the Golden Gate theater. What an absolutely delightful experience. We brought tchotchkes to pawn, which the 'cashier' accepted, and then opened a hidden door to let us into the restaurant. Food was delicious, drinks were great, and we exited through a different hidden door which dropped us in a *different* bar (Monarch). A++ will go again. https://sf.eater.com/2019/1/24/18195549/the-pawn-shop-soma-monarch-sf-tapas-restaurant-bar-opens

Nature, like many journals, has historically emphasized producing exciting, innovative outcomes as the basis for publication. Incentivizing researchers for rewards based on outcomes is a key contributor to many of the dysfunctional practices that the reform movement aims to address. Nature's adoption of Registered Reports is a powerful signal for the real opportunity to change the reward system. Culture change is a grind, but it is grinding on.

https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-00506-2.

New study: "The strongest…predictor of perceived danger of #misinformation is the third-person effect (i.e., the perception that others are more vulnerable to misinformation than the self) and, in particular, the belief that ‘distant’ others (as opposed to family and friends) are vulnerable to misinformation. The belief that societal problems have simple solutions and clear causes was consistently, but weakly, associated with perceived danger of online misinformation."

Rly cool times to be doing data analysis/vis in. So many advancements coming so fast & furious.

“Instead of saying “employers are using AI to analyze workers’ emotions” we might say “employers are using software advertised as having the ability to label workers’ emotions based on images of them from photographs and video. I'm guessing most people are thinking primarily about UF and FSU in regard to DeSantis's anti-education bill. You might not realize that Central Florida and FIU are, respectively, the 2nd and 5th largest student bodies in the US (I discount Liberty b/c most of its students are virtual). South Florida also regularly appears in the top 10 lists of student bodies. The amount of students and faculty that would be affected is enormous. https://www.usnews.com/education/best-colleges/the-short-list-college/articles/colleges-with-the-most-undergraduates

I second this recommendation of @skamille's The Manager's Path, but broaden it to include anyone interested in *design* management roles. Pretty much all the principles apply.

https://hachyderm.io/@zef/109931282962821453

Just completed a quick reread of The Manager’s Path. Still my #1 recommended book for anybody interested in exploring engineering management roles. Even just to discover this is not for you. https://www.amazon.com/Managers-Path-Leaders-Navigating-Growth/dp/1491973897

Prompted by a thread from @alexxkittle, here's a piece by the photographer Sharon Core (who worked as a pastry chef while an art student) from her amazing "Thiebauds" series, in which she recreates some of Wayne Thiebaud's paintings as photographs. More at http://sharoncore.net/thiebauds/r3hmgvvzs1fom7n3afvz7tmfms1ano #photography #popart

Our new paper on indeterminate art that has been accepted to _Psychology of Aesthetics, Creativity, and The Arts_. We found that a word-association methodology predicts peoples' aesthetic preferences. We performed tests using GAN-generated imagery from Artbreeder. https://psyarxiv.com/nd653

But, to get to this result, we employed different methodologies that gave different results, providing more reasons to question the uncritical reliance on MTurk evaluations in computer graphics and vision.

title: Scott Adams Poses as His Own Fan on Message Boards to Defend Himself

last_post.content: In recognition of Scott Adams Finding Out Day, for all who celebrate, please enjoy the time in 2011 that he made a sock puppet to self-aggrandize himself on Metafilter, a community blog, and then got revealed only for him to say “I’m the genius winner here, lol” and float away. https://comicsalliance.com/scott-adams-plannedchaos-sockpuppet/
